title: Braes o' Balquhidder. A novel
author: Aytoun, Douglas.
snippet: Accordingly, in his twentieth year, Jack Craigie became a pupil of Mr. Romanes, the tenant of Niddry Mains, a farm of some 500 acres situated about ten miles west of Edinburgh.

title: Braes o' Balquhidder. A novel
author: Aytoun, Douglas.
snippet: What her Ladyship's verdict might then have been on Jack's new departure no one at this date can determine. The Craigies greatly regretted the enforced silence they had to maintain, but resolved to fully acquaint his aunt of the youth's transportation to Niddry Mains as soon as they had intelligence of her convalescence.

title: Braes o' Balquhidder. A novel
author: Aytoun, Douglas.
snippet: We must now make the personal acquaintance of Jack, (who had not as yet become known outside of his own circle by the flattering adjective which afterwards did duty before his baptismal name) as he became installed at Niddry Mains for agricultural training.

title: Braes o' Balquhidder. A novel
author: Aytoun, Douglas.
snippet: He was just the 'breezy' kind of youth that life at Niddry Mains suited. Mentally and physically, he revelled in it from the very first; and looked forward to such a future, on a more elevated social plane, as quite an ideal existence.

title: Braes o' Balquhidder. A novel
author: Aytoun, Douglas.
snippet: Anyhow, Jack and I must have a very " tall talk," as Jonathan says, about his future. I don't suppose he will now care to pursue his studies as an apprentice-pupil of Mr. Romanes at Niddry Mains ; What say you, lad ? '

title: Braes o' Balquhidder. A novel
author: Aytoun, Douglas.
snippet: So Jack went back to Niddry Mains on the very day —as it fell out—of Aunt Flora's marriage. Florence was no doubt en fete on that auspicious occasion, if all that the new Princess had said in her letters were true.

title: Braes o' Balquhidder. A novel
author: Aytoun, Douglas.
snippet: The outcome of that evening's sitting in Mr. Leslie's sanctum was the transference of Jack from Niddry Mains to the Meadows, and his daily attendance at the studio of a well-known training artist in the near vicinity.
